newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Maastricht, Liege airports discuss cargo links.
newsitem.headline: Maastricht, Liege airports discuss cargo links.

text.p: Maastricht Aachen Airport (MAA) and Liege Airport are studying a possible cargo co-operation deal, an MAA spokesman told Reuters.
"We are looking at each other not as enemies but as possible partners," he said. Talks have taken place between the Dutch and Belgian airports already concerning this, he added.
He said any agreement would be for cargo operations only, not for passenger business.
Possible areas of interest could when bad weather at either airport allowed for aircraft to be routed via either one, he said.
Or if flights were delayed and could not land at Maastricht because of its restricted night flight policy, then they could instead land at Liege.
But he stressed that there was nothing concrete in place at the moment. There were still questions concerning cargo handling, he added.
At Liege airport, Belgavia has a monopoly handling concession from the Belgian government.
Maastricht Handling carries out cargo handling at the Dutch airport.
"At the moment, it is an exchange of ideas to see if we can help each other," he added.
